info: Significant increase in the emerging industrial economies of China and India with the adoption of Industry 4.0 technologies.
info_original: The emerging manufacturing economies of China and India whilst currently lagging behind a number of the developed economies are predicted to rise significantly over the next few years via the adoption of I4 .0 technologies.

info: The biggest improvements in industry 4.0 are in the areas of information interoperability, data standardization and advanced analytics.
info_original: It shows the level of maturity of Industry 4.0 and the key ?ndings of this study are as follows : ? 85% of manufacturing companies globally are aware of the potential of technologies for increasing asset ef?ciency ? However, only 15% of enterprises surveyed have so far implemented dedicated strategies to this end by analyzing data from their machines ? The research revealed that the largest improvements planned over the next ?ve years are in the areas of information interoperability, data standardization and advanced analytics ? It is interesting that one ?fth of companies believe that by 2020 will achieve anything beyond recognizing the potential of the Industry 4.0 concept.
nome_arquivo: Enterprise information systems and technologies in Czech companies from the perspective of trends in industry 4.0

info: One half of industrial players in manufacturing are expected to use wearable technologies.

info: Creation of competitive advantage by the Russian Federation through the Program for the development of the digital economy and consequent implementation of Industry 4.0.

info: Four key areas contributed to a joint vision about an ideal state in 2030: legal framework/standards, characteristics of future production networks, transnational and cross-sectoral cooperation, as well as social requirements.
info_original: After the two expert inputs followed a facilitated discussion and brainstorming on questions such as ` What are characteristics of secure Industry 4.0 value creation networks or ` Which requirements do they meet regarding systems, companies, people ? Clustering the brainstorming results of the two tables on security for example led to four key areas that built the pillars for a joint vision on an ideal state in 2030: legal framework/standards, characteristics of future production networks, transnational and intersectoral cooperation as well as social requirements.
nome_arquivo: Foresight and technology assessment for the Austrian parliament — Finding new ways of debating the future of industry 4.0

info:
The forecast for more sustainable manufacturing in the UK with the objective of a sustainable industrial ecosystem will be as follows: 
- Efficiency & Resilience between 2013 to 2025 through Minimizing material inputs; waste management; energy efficiency; reduced water use; land use efficiency; leadership in low carbon technology.
- Experimenting with new systems between 2025 and 2050 through new forms of value associated with products including sustainability; Reused, remanufactured, recycled, and redesigned products with recovery in mind; More durable products designed for shared ownership; Internal supply chains of spare capacity built to ensure resilience.
- A resource-constrained world after 2050 where products use smaller amounts of materials and energy; Material is not filled on land but kept in a "production cycle"; Cleaner, quieter factories close to consumers, suppliers, and academic institutions; Supply chains with low capacity at all stages.
info_original: ? 2025 -- 2050: Experimentation with new systems.
nome_arquivo: Sustainable manufacturing in Industry 4.0: an emerging research agenda

info: The main objective, decarbonization, has been set to a reduction of greenhouse gas  emissions to 80-95% below 1990 levels for 2050.

nome_arquivo: Future european energy markets and industry 4.0 potential in energy transition towards decarbonization
